tit.e: Koho MISHOSAI (a Japanese flower arrangement expert)
tit.cmt: 人名のため、補足は削除しました。

sen.j: 未生斎広甫（みしょうさい こうほ、寛政3年（1791年） - 文久元年（1861年）7月）は、日本の華道家。
sen.e: "Koho MISHOSAI" (1791- July, 1861) was a Japanese expert of flower arrangement.
Koho MISHOSAI (1791- August, 1861) was a Japanese expert of flower arrangement.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: Koho MISHOSAI (1791- August, 1861) was a Japanese expert of flower arrangement.

sen.j: 未生流二代目当主。
sen.e: He was the second head of Misho-ryu school of flower arrangement.
He was the second head of Misho school of flower arrangement.
He was the second head of Misho school of flower arrangement.

sen.j: 本名上田広甫。
sen.e: His real name was Koho UEDA.
His real name was Koho UEDA.
His real name was Koho UEDA.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: History:
History
sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。
sen.e: History

sen.j: 寛政3年（1791年）に但馬国土居村（現兵庫県香住町（旧城崎郡））で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Doi village of Tajima province (current Kasumi-cho (former Kinosaki-gun), Hyogo Prefecture).
He was born in Doi village of Tajima Province (current Kasumi-cho [former Kinosaki-gun], Hyogo Prefecture) in 1791.
sen.cmt: Province を大文字にしました。1791年を追加しました。
sen.e: He was born in Doi village of Tajima Province (current Kasumi-cho [former Kinosaki-gun], Hyogo Prefecture) in 1791.

sen.j: 生家は、城崎の庄屋上田家である。
sen.e: His birth place was the house of Ueda family, shoya (village headman's family) of Kinosaki.
His birth place was the house of Ueda family, shoya (village headman's family) of Kinosaki.
His birth place was the house of Ueda family, shoya (village headman's family) of Kinosaki.

sen.j: 当時は奉公であった。
sen.e: He was then an apprentice to the family.
He was then an apprentice to the family.
He was then an apprentice to the family.

sen.j: 幼名は、上田安太郎（やすたろう）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Yasutaro UEDA.
His childhood name was Yasutaro UEDA.
His childhood name was Yasutaro UEDA.

sen.j: 父親は、同じく庄屋として栄華を誇った上田九左衛門兼重の息子上田九助。
sen.e: His father was Kyusuke UEDA, a son of Kyuzaemon UEDA who also boasted his prosperity as shoya (a village headman).
sen.cmt: 「上田九助」「上田久左衛門」の読み方不詳。
sen.e: His father was Kyusuke UEDA, a son of Kyuzaemon UEDA who also boasted his prosperity as shoya.
sen.cmt: 既出単語の説明を削除しました。
sen.e: His father was Kyusuke UEDA, a son of Kyuzaemon UEDA who also boasted his prosperity as shoya.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)2年（1805年）に、後に共同で未生流を開く事となる未生斎一甫が上田家を訪れる。
sen.e: In 1805, Ueda family received a visit of Ippo MISHOSAI who would later establish Misho-ryu school of flower arrangement in collaboration with Koho MISHOSAI.
In 1805, Ueda family received a visit of Ippo MISHOSAI who would later establish Misho school of flower arrangement in collaboration with Koho MISHOSAI.
In 1805, Ueda family received a visit of Ippo MISHOSAI who would later establish Misho school of flower arrangement in collaboration with Koho MISHOSAI.

sen.j: そこで一甫は広甫の芸道を見出し、摂津国大阪に連れて行く事を決意した。
sen.e: There, Ippo acknowledged an accomplishment of Koho and determined to take him to Osaka, Settsu Province.
There, Ippo acknowledged an accomplishment of Koho and determined to take him to Osaka, Settsu Province.
There, Ippo acknowledged an accomplishment of Koho and determined to take him to Osaka, Settsu Province.

sen.j: 大阪に着き、未生斎広甫は未生斎一甫と未生流を開いた。
sen.e: After arriving at Osaka, Koho and Ippo MISHOSAI founded Misho-ryu school of flower arrangement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After arriving at Osaka, Koho and Ippo MISHOSAI founded Misho school of flower arrangement.
After arriving at Osaka, Koho and Ippo MISHOSAI founded Misho school of flower arrangement.

sen.j: 広甫は、自ら不濁斎広甫と名乗るようになった。
sen.e: Koho became to call himself Koho FUSHOKUSAI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「不濁斎広甫」の読み方不詳。
sen.e: Koho came to call himself Koho FUSHOKUSAI.
Koho came to call himself Koho FUSHOKUSAI.

sen.j: 未生流二代目当主を引き継いた後、文政12年（1829年）に大覚寺（現大覚寺）の華道を職とする花務職に任命される。
sen.e: After becoming the second head of Misho-ryu school, Koho was assigned to a responsible post for flower arrangement services at Daikaku-ji Temple (current Daikaku-ji) in 1829.
After becoming the second head of Misho school, Koho was assigned to a responsible post for flower arrangement services at Daikaku-ji Temple (current Daikaku-ji Temple) in 1829.
After becoming the second head of Misho school, Koho was assigned to a responsible post for flower arrangement services at Daikaku-ji Temple (current Daikaku-ji Temple) in 1829.

sen.j: また、僧位の法橋と法眼を賜っている。
sen.e: Also he was awarded with hokkyo and hogen (the third and the second highest ranks in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests, respectively).
Also he was awarded with hokkyo and hogen (the third and the second highest ranks in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests, respectively).
Also he was awarded with hokkyo and hogen (the third and the second highest ranks in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests, respectively).

sen.j: そこで宇多天皇から「嵯峨御流」の普及を懇願され、積極的に普及に取り組み、「嵯峨御流」は全国的に知られる事となった。
sen.e: Being ardently asked by Emperor Uda, he devoted himself to disseminate "Saga-goryu" school of flower arrangement, so that the school has became well-known all over the country.
Being ardently asked by Emperor Uda, he devoted himself to disseminate 'Saga Goryu' school of flower arrangement, so that 'Saga Goryu' became well-known all over the country.
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。嵯峨御流のホームページを参照し、Saga Goryu としました。
sen.e: Being ardently asked by Emperor Uda, he devoted himself to disseminate 'Saga Goryu' school of flower arrangement, so that 'Saga Goryu' became well-known all over the country.

sen.j: 文久元年（1861年）7月、大阪で没した。
sen.e: He died in Osaka in July, 1861.
He died in Osaka in August, 1861.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: He died in Osaka in August, 1861.

sen.j: 著作
sen.e: Literary work:
Literary work
sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。
sen.e: Literary work

sen.j: 『四方の薫里』
sen.e: "Yomo no Kaori"
"Yomo no Kaori"
"Yomo no Kaori"

sen.j: 『花術三才噺』 - 天保6年（1835年）刊行
sen.e: "Kajutsu Sansai Banashi" -- published in 1835
"Kajutsu Sansai Banashi": Published in 1835
sen.cmt: コロンを追加しました。
sen.e: "Kajutsu Sansai Banashi": Published in 1835
